references.paper_title: Glide: Towards photorealistic image generation and editing with text-guided diffusion models
references.reason: This paper is significant as it introduces GLIDE, a text-guided diffusion model, which is a crucial step towards photorealistic image generation and editing, as indicated by its use in the context of GPT-40 image generation capabilities.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper is essential because it presents Latent Diffusion Models (LDMs), which balance efficiency and quality in image generation through iterative denoising in compressed latent spaces, which is a frequently referenced technique in multimodal AI.
This paper is considered a seminal work on denoising diffusion probabilistic models, an approach that significantly advanced image generation techniques and has had a lasting impact on the field.

references.paper_title: Photorealistic text-to-image diffusion models with deep language understanding
references.reason: This is a foundational paper for text-to-image generation using diffusion models, and is important as the current work assesses whether GPT-4O integrates world knowledge as well as diffusion models.

references.paper_title: Unified language-vision pretraining with dynamic discrete visual tokenization
references.reason: This paper introduces a unified language-vision pretraining approach that is significant because it directly relates to the architecture and capabilities of multimodal systems like GPT-40, thus being an important reference.
